meanings.definition: The act of selling goods by traveling from place to place.
meanings.sent1: The pedlaries of fruits and vegetables brought fresh produce to our neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The pedlaries set up their stalls at the market every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The pedlaries had a race to see who could sell the most items in a day.
meanings.sent4: Her voice carried through the streets like the pedlaries' calls for attention.
meanings.sent5: The colorful umbrellas of the pedlaries brightened up the dull street.

meanings.definition: A person who sells goods by traveling from place to place.
meanings.sent1: The pedlaries greeted each customer with a warm smile.
meanings.sent2: We bought a beautiful rug from the pedlaries who passed by our house.
meanings.sent3: The pedlaries' cart broke down, and they had to push it all the way to the next town.
meanings.sent4: She was a pedlaries of stories, always sharing tales from her travels.
meanings.sent5: The pedlaries' song echoed through the valley, drawing people to their wares.
